sub_section_analysis.refined_text:
• 
(Visio 2010) Choose Acrobat > Create and Send For Review.

About Acrobat PDFMaker 
PDFMaker is an Acrobat feature that operates within many business applications, such as 
Microsoft Office applications, AutoCAD, and Lotus Notes.

Do any of the following: 
• 
In Acrobat, select Create from the global toolbar.

When you install Acrobat, 
PDFMaker controls appear in the work area of the authoring application.

It involves 
clicking an Acrobat PDFMaker toolbar button or choosing a command on the Adobe PDF menu.

If you’re creating a PDF from a Microsoft 
Office document and you want to use these features, use PDFMaker.

Note:  
(Windows) For Microsoft Office documents, the Adobe PDF printer does not include some of 
the features that are available from PDFMaker.

Visio-specific options on the Settings tab (Acrobat Pro) 
The following options appear when you open the PDFMaker settings from within Microsoft 
Visio.

Embed Scale Information 
Preserves drawing-scale information, which is usable with the Acrobat measurement tools.

You can also organize the Visio layers 
in layer sets, which are folders in the Acrobat Layers panel.

Edit images or objects in a PDF 
 
About editing text and images 
Adobe Acrobat provides powerful tools and capabilities for editing PDF images and text.

Refer to the following topics to learn how to add, resize, move, or replace images and objects 
in a PDF using Acrobat.

You can also enhance document accessibility using Acrobat's features, such as adding 
alternative text for images and proper content tagging.
Open the PDF document in Adobe Acrobat.

You can use the options in the Edit panel to replace, edit, or 
add text to a PDF.

If you encounter compatibility issues, try updating Adobe 
Acrobat.

The object is automatically updated and 
displayed in the PDF when you bring Acrobat to the foreground.
For more information, see Scan documents to PDF.
Open the photograph or image of the document in Acrobat.

Extract random pages from a PDF 
You can also select and extract discontinuous pages from the page thumbnails in the right 
navigation pane of Acrobat.

Overview 
Acrobat allows you to export images and text selections from a PDF to different file formats.

You can let Acrobat determine these 
settings automatically.

You can let Acrobat determine these 
settings automatically.

You can let Acrobat determine these 
settings automatically.

Text Recognition Settings 
• 
Recognize Text If Needed: Recognizes text if the PDF contains images that contain text.

Select Acrobat in the upper-left (macOS) or Menu in the upper-left (Windows), then 
select Preferences.

Note:  
You can save all the images from a PDF.

Copy images 
Use the Select tool to copy and paste individual images from a PDF to the clipboard, another 
application, or a file.

Export objects to separate PDF 
Using the Edit Object tool, you can save objects into a separate PDF.
Select All tools > Use print production > Edit object.

Go to Acrobat or Acrobat Reader Home and then from under Agreements, 
select Adobe Acrobat Sign.

When you create a different form, redo this 
task to enable Acrobat Reader users to use the tools.

Acrobat 
also allows you to send your completed forms to others and securely save them in Adobe 
cloud storage.

Fill and Sign PDF Forms 
You can easily fill, sign, and share your documents using Acrobat's Fill & Sign tool.

Change flat forms to fillable (Acrobat Pro) 
You can change a flat form to a fillable form by either using the Prepare Form tool or 
enabling the Fill & Sign tools.

Acrobat online 
Alternatively, in Acrobat Home, select All tools, then select AI Assistant or Generative 
summary tool.

Overview of generative AI features 
Use the generative AI features in Acrobat and Acrobat Reader to quickly scan through 
lengthy, complex PDF content and get answers or generate a summary.

Use generative AI features in Acrobat Reader 
If you are signed in to Acrobat Reader, you can access the generative AI features from 
Home.

You can access the generative AI features from Acrobat Reader, Acrobat 
desktop and online, and Acrobat for Microsoft Teams.

Rate your experience with the generative AI 
features 
After using the AI features four or more times, Acrobat or Acrobat Reader prompts you to rate 
your overall experience with the AI Assistant and Generative summary features.

Note:  
Acrobat Classic does not support AI Assistant.

You can request access to 
the AI Assistant for Acrobat from the Acrobat desktop app, Acrobat on the web, Acrobat 
browser extension, and Acrobat for Microsoft Teams.

Administer AI Assistant for enterprises 
Adobe's AI Assistant for enterprises extends generative AI features to Acrobat on the web, 
mobile, and desktop platforms.
As a Teams user, learn how to request access to AI Assistant for Acrobat from within the app.

License deployment 
You can manage the deployment of Acrobat AI Assistant through the Adobe Admin Console.
Alternatively, from Acrobat Home, select See all tools.
Adobe Acrobat supports a range of solutions for electronic and digital signatures.

Additional signing options in Acrobat include 
integration with Adobe Acrobat Sign.

Consider signing up for Adobe Acrobat Sign online, the leader in e-signatures and web 
contracting.

With Acrobat Sign, you can get PDF, Microsoft Word, and other documents sent, 
signed, and filed instantly.

Acrobat and Acrobat Reader can embed the necessary elements if available, and the PDF 
creator must enable usage rights for Acrobat Reader users by going to the hamburger 
menu   (Windows) or the Acrobat menu (macOS) > Save as other > Acrobat Reader 
extended PDF.
Select the hamburger menu   (Windows®), or go to Acrobat (macOS)> Preferences.

XML data signatures 
Acrobat and Acrobat Reader support XML data signatures that are used to sign data in XML 
Forms Architectures (XFA) forms.

Navigate to the hamburger menu   (Windows) or the Acrobat menu (macOS) 
> Preferences > Signatures.

• 
To view the name of the organization or person that signed the PDF Portfolio, hover 
the pointer over the Signature Badge.
Choose Acrobat > Create And Send For Review.

They can also use Acrobat Reader or 
Acrobat desktop applications to add comments.

They can also use Acrobat Reader or 
Acrobat desktop applications to add comments.

Note: 
• 
The computer must be connected to the Internet to start a shared review in Acrobat.

Note: 
• 
The computer must be connected to the Internet to start a shared review in Acrobat.

Annotations and drawing markup tools 
overview 
Note: In Acrobat Reader, complete commenting tools are available only in PDFs 
with commenting enabled.

Note:  
In Acrobat Pro, you can add tags to your comments so that readers with motion or vision 
limitations can read them using assistive technologies.

Add an arrow, or shape 
Note: In Acrobat Reader , drawing tools are available only in PDFs that have commenting 
enabled.

Our online PDF editor lets you easily add text, 
sticky notes, highlights, drawings, and more to PDFs.

Drawing Tools menu 
Select an annotation or drawing markup tool 
From the quick tools menu on the left, select the desired annotation to add to the PDF.

Export Expert: Test Your Acrobat Exporting Skills 
 
Welcome to the ultimate test of your Acrobat exporting skills!

Dive into real-world scenarios, answer intriguing questions, and see if you have what it takes 
to be a true PDF exporting pro 
 
1.

Do you use Acrobat to 
convert your PDF to a PowerPoint file or manually recreate the slides?

Think you know everything 
about saving, converting, and exporting PDFs?
Yes or No: Can you select and copy text and images from a PDF using the Select tool?

Conclusion 
Sharing PDFs with Adobe Acrobat is straightforward and efficient, 
whether you're working on a general project or managing real estate 
documents.

The Ultimate PDF Sharing Checklist 
Sharing PDFs can be a breeze with Adobe Acrobat.

Let's dive 
into the essentials of sharing PDFs effectively.

Here's a tailored checklist to 
help you manage your PDF sharing needs.

Real Estate Sharing Checklist 
•  Open Your Property Document 
• Have you launched Acrobat or Acrobat Reader and opened 
the property listing or contract you need to share?
